uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data

Class ConstIndexedSQLValue<T extends DataObject,I extends DataObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.ConstIndexedSQLValue<T,I>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of owning/home table.
    I - Type of remote table
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FilterProvider<T,IndexedReference<I>>, GroupingSQLValue<IndexedReference<I>>, IndexedSQLValue<T,I>, SQLValue<IndexedReference<I>>, Targetted<IndexedReference<I>>

    public class ConstIndexedSQLValue<T extends DataObject,I extends DataObject>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IndexedSQLValue<T,I>, GroupingSQLValue<IndexedReference<I>>
    a IndexedSQLValue that resolves to a constant value. It adds the id of the reference to the SQL statement. This is therefore illegal in a GROUP BY clause so the class implements GroupingSQLValue.
    Author:
    spb
    See Also:
    SQLGroupMapper
